revised_title: GABA and Glycine-Activated Currents in Hippocampal Neurons
tldr: This study investigates GABA- and glycine-activated currents in post-natal tissue-cultured hippocampal neurons using the patch-clamp technique. The results show that both GABA and glycine currents exhibit outward rectification and partial desensitization. The study also reveals similarities between GABA- and glycine-activated currents, suggesting that both agonists activate comparable numbers of anatomically distinct channels with very similar permeation properties.
